title: Creative pizzas you can try at home
text:

KUSA Mackenzie Concepcion, 9:52 a.m. MDT October 17, 2015 To make a white pizza, you’ll need mozzarella cheese, olive oil, basil, garlic, tomatoes and oregano. (Photo: KUSA) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
DENVER – October happens to be National Pizza Month, and the folks at Bonnie Brae know a thing or two about that. 
Bonnie Brae Tavern has been serving up creative pies in Denver since 1934. 
Owners Ricky and Michael Dire join 9NEWS Saturday morning to make pizza and talk a little about their restaurant. 
Those at home can probably easily top their pizzas with the ingredients already in their kitchen – it's just a matter of getting creative. 
People can buy dough, marinara sauce and try out some of the toppings Ricky and Michael brought in. 
To make a white pizza, you'll need mozzarella cheese, olive oil, basil, garlic, tomatoes and oregano. 
White pizzas are tomato-sauceless, and if that just isn't for you, try making the cheeseburger pizza. 
For that, you'll need ground beef, mozzarella or American cheese, dill pickles and onion. 
You can try out your own creation in your home or at Bonnie Brae, where you can build your own creative pie.
